expandableInfoRow.title: Vignette for Bulgaria - Everything You Need to Know
expandableInfoRow.whatType: What type of vignette to choose?
expandableInfoRow.description: If you are planning to travel with a car in Bulgaria, you must purchase a vignette for Bulgaria. This is an electronic toll for using the national road network, which is valid for light and heavy vehicles. Without a valid vignette, you risk a fine, so it is important to inform yourself in advance.
expandableInfoRow.whatTypeDescription: There are several types of vignettes – daily, weekend, weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual. The most common type for tourists is the weekend vignette, while for frequent travelers it is the annual vignette. The electronic system makes the purchase and check easier, as it can be purchased online or at a toll booth.
expandableInfoRow.howToBuyDescription: You can easily purchase an electronic vignette for Bulgaria through the official website http://bgtoll.bg or through mobile applications. You only need to enter the registration number of the vehicle, the country of registration and select the validity period.
expandableInfoRow.checkDescription: The validity check is done through cameras and mobile teams. You can check the status of your vignette online. Make sure the entered data is correct, as the system does not allow corrections after activation.

whatIsTollTax.title: What is toll tax?
whatIsTollTax.subtitle: Special charging regime for heavy vehicles
whatIsTollTax.description1: Unlike electronic vignettes intended for light vehicles, toll taxes in Bulgaria apply to heavy vehicles and buses.
whatIsTollTax.description2: This regime is based on distance traveled and vehicle category, ensuring fair charging for the greater load on road infrastructure.
whatIsTollTax.description3: Understand the toll charging system to plan your routes and manage payments effectively. Toll taxes are collected for passage through certain bridges, tunnels and specific road sections outside the main vignette system.
